summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent to colleagues coordinating evidence in the Epstein case, listing serial numbers for digital evidence seized from New York and the island (likely Little St. James), including hard drives, computers, loose media, and cell phone extractions.

persons.name: Steve
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who provided a rundown on processed evidence for the Epstein case, including hard drives, computers, and other media.

persons.name: Flatley
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to evidence processing, stating there were more MAC computers from New York and the island that needed processing.

events.title: Evidence coordination email
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends an email to coordinate evidence serial numbers with CART serial numbers for the Epstein case, listing seized digital evidence from New York and an island location.

locations: Island (likely referring to Little St. James, US Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email from June 2020 coordinating evidence in the Epstein investigation.
It lists extensive digital evidence seized from New York and an island location, including hard drives, MAC/Windows computers, loose media (cameras, thumb drives), DVRs, and cell phone extractions.
The evidence includes items labeled as evidence from the original Florida case against Epstein.
The email indicates ongoing processing of additional MAC computers from both locations.
The correspondence shows coordination between FBI agents and evidence processors (Steve, Flatley) in the investigation.
